channel.title: Testers wanted: Whonix 8 - Tor Browser Updater / whonixcheck - bugfix
channel.description:
Tor Browser version check url has been changed by The Tor Project (https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/8940#comment:21).
Please run these two commands.
[code]sudo sed -i "s#https://check.torproject.org/RecommendedTBBVersions#https://www.torproject.org/projects/torbrowser/RecommendedTBBVersions#g" /usr/lib/whonix/whonixcheck/65_check-torbrowser ; echo $?[/code]
[code]sudo sed -i "s#https://check.torproject.org/RecommendedTBBVersions#https://www.torproject.org/projects/torbrowser/RecommendedTBBVersions#g" /usr/bin/torbrowser ; echo $?[/code]
Then check if whonixcheck and Whonix's Tor Browser updater are still working for you.
If this works, I plan to write a blog post about this.

item.title: Testers wanted: Whonix 8 - Tor Browser Updater / whonixcheck - bugfix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This is supposed as a stable hotfix for versions 8, 8.1, 8.2, 8.3. As a stopgap until Whonix 9.

Read full topic
item.source: Testers wanted: Whonix 8 - Tor Browser Updater / whonixcheck - bugfix

item.title: Testers wanted: Whonix 8 - Tor Browser Updater / whonixcheck - bugfix
item.dc:creator: troubadour
item.description:
No. The first command modifies “/usr/lib/whonix/whonixcheck/65_check-torbrowser” which does not exist on this side (I believe it was changed in Whonix 8.2.2).

If I run

sudo sed -i "s#https://check.torproject.org/RecommendedTBBVersions#https://www.torproject.org/projects/torbrowser/RecommendedTBBVersions#g" /usr/lib/whonixcheck/check_torbrowser ; echo $?
it returns 0 and whonixcheck is still working.

Read full topic
item.source: Testers wanted: Whonix 8 - Tor Browser Updater / whonixcheck - bugfix
